Package fr.uge.net.tcp.nonblocking.context

Class AbstractContext

java.lang.Object
fr.uge.net.tcp.nonblocking.context.AbstractContext
All Implemented Interfaces:
Context
public abstract class AbstractContext
extends java.lang.Object
implements Context
Abstract context that is used to group all common methods among all implementations of Context.

    • processIn

      Reads what's inside bbIn and do something with it.

    • queueMessage

      public void queueMessage​(java.nio.ByteBuffer buff)
      Adds this buffer to the queue and tries to fill bbOut.
      Parameters:
      buff - the buffer in write mode to add to the queue to send.

    • insertFirstMessage

      public void insertFirstMessage​(java.nio.ByteBuffer buff)
      Adds this buffer at the start of queue and tries to fill bbOut.
      Parameters:
      buff - the buffer in write mode to add to the queue to send.

    • processOut

      public void processOut()
      Takes an element from the queue and stores it into bbOut if empty.

    • updateInterestOps

      public int updateInterestOps()
      Updates the interest operators of key based on the values inside of bbIn and bbOut. The operators will be set to:
      • SelectionKey.OP_READ if the channel isn't closed and there's space left in bbIn.
      • SelectionKey.OP_WRITE if bbOut has something to write.
      The operators can be cumulated. If none of the above conditions are met, the channel is closed.
      Returns:
      the value of the operator assigned to the key.

    • doRead

      public void doRead() throws java.io.IOException
      Reads data in bbIn. If there is no data to read, closed is set to true.
      Specified by:
      doRead in interface Context
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

    • doWrite

      public void doWrite() throws java.io.IOException
      Writes data from bbOut.
      Specified by:
      doWrite in interface Context
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

    • doConnect

      public void doConnect() throws java.io.IOException
      If the connection is successful, updates interest operator.
      Specified by:
      doConnect in interface Context
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

    • isConnected

      public boolean isConnected()
      Returns:
      if the current socket is closed or not.

    • setConnected

      public void setConnected()
      Force the context to consider itself connected even if it's not supposed to.

    • close

      public void close()
      Closes properly the socket.
